column1:
Localization files are formatted like CSV so they can be easily edited,
however formatting has strict rules for easy parsing. Most of these rules
are already handled by Excel / Libre / etc., so you don't have to worry
about them in normal usage. However, if your localization file seems to
be corrupted, these rules may be helpful for debugging purposes...
- In general, any consecutive string of \r and \n (in any order) will be
  treated as one SINGLE line break, except within an enclosed context
- The first 4 rows can be arbitrarily long
  - The first cell of first row is used to store this block of instruction
    text
  - The first 3 cells of the fourth row is used as headers
  - All other cells in the first and fourth rows are ignored
  - Columns in the second row alternate between property and value (ex.
    ' foo | 1 | bar | 3.5 | ... '
    - Any whitespaces before and after the property name are ignored
  - Columns in the third row are exclusively comments for properties in the
    second row
- Every following line can include any number of cells, but only the
  first three will be parsed (you can use the rest as comments if needed)
- The file must end in a sequence of \r and \n's
- Every cell containing a ^, \r, or \n must be enclosed in "
  - If a " is encountered right after a non-enclosed separator, \r, or \n,
    then the parser is said to enter an "enclosed context", such context
    ends immediately when a non-escaped " that is not followed by \r, \n,
    or a separator is encountered
  - " within each cell should be escaped using another " in front of it,
  - If a " is encountered in a non-enclosed context, and it is not right
    after a separator, \r, or \n, then it is entirely ignored
  - If a non-escaped " is encountered in an enclosed context...
    - If it is followed by a separator, \r, or \n, then it is considered
      the closing quote of the current context
    - Otherwise, it is ignored
  - If a separator, \r, or \n is encountered while in an enclosed context,
    it will be preserved
Set to 1 allow the parser to read this file, otherwise it will be skipped and the default English localization will be used as fallback
column3: Float value that scales font size of all dialogue text, this is an option separate because the English font of this game is *really* tiny, like about 1/3 of regular font when under the same font size.
column5: Float value that scales font size of all dialogue text, this is an option separate because the English font of this game is *really* tiny, like about 1/3 of regular font when under the same font size. Recommended setting is around 0.3~0.6.

column2: I was doing maintenance on the power cause the line got chewed out. When a RAT showed up and started squeakin' about. Gave me a lil' jump and I tripped. Flipped the switch and doors shut, and dropped my keys. Then that darn RAT took 'em! And now here I am. In a bit of a tickle one might say.

column2: The Factory foreman would've been ON ME if it wasn't fixed.
Someone there? Welcome to the Cavern Station!
I'd show you in, but I can't quite see the door.
Ah... so dark again.
There's the door! And my work bench!
Thanks for getting things up and running again.
Ever since they put me on fungus removal duty it's been hard to see.
These 10 kilowatt lights are so convenient though!
Why do people write so small... what do these labels even say?
The minecart is broken!
We'll need supplies from the jungle to fix it.
What? The bridge is broken??
Ugh... this is never getting fixed.
Is the bridge fixed yet?
There's a path to Canopy Town behind Bob's Tavern but... that's way too far for us.
Oh man you fixed it! We can finally work on fixing the transport from the Crystal Mines.
The Mines? They're shipping materials to MRI.
Something about them holds a lot of power. Good for fuel and whatever.
Oh man you fixed it! We can finally work on fixing the transport from the Crystal Mines.
The Mines? They're shipping materials to MRI.
Something about them holds a lot of power. Good for fuel and whatever.
woah, you checked out behind the waterfall too?
i seem to have lost my flashlight in these strange mushrooms
try turning on the power station, the key should be nearby
i wonder how the moss came to be... ive never seen anything like it!
i wonder what happens if i... touch it?
you again! i seem to have lost my flashlight in these strange mushrooms
try turning on the power station, the key should be nearby
i wonder how the moss came to be... I've never seen anything like it!
i wonder what happens if i... touch it?
the station's back on! think itll help find my flashlight?
this light here should help with the mushrooms around it
woah!! where did you found my flashlight?!
wait... it doesn't look like it works...
theres fungi inside the light. the bulb looks... shattered?
oh well! make sure to turn on the station light!
im looking for some ruins deeper in these caves, keep an eye out.
the flashlight doesn't look like it works...
woah, theres fungi inside the light. the bulb looks... shattered?
oh well! im looking for some ruins deeper in these caves, keep an eye out.
i lost my backup light too (sorry) and now I can't study these ruins..
could you light up <wavy>the ENTIRE cavern</wavy> for me?
now! what do these say...
the ancient civilization's notes...
rearranging...
a <#ff9040>scroll</color>?!
this is all so fascinating! i wonder how the ancient civilization created these tools.
i... i have to find the source of this magic!
im going to the desert! who knows what might be afoot.
chad..? where are you chaaddddd
chad c'mon lets go!
a-are you gambling?? im not paying you for this lets go get the <#ff9040>scroll</color>
Rats! The power line's been chewed up again.
Jimbobby is stuck behind the door to the Crystal Caves!
Gah! That power line can't even be fixed!
Is that the rat?! Kill it! Git!
Gah! It's so fast!
The rats done! But so is the wire.
And I pray Jimbobby stays strong.
Stranger! Please, help Jimbobby if you can!
Jimbobby is saved!
And the rail line's fixed?! You, sir, are a miracle worker!
Gah, what was the protocol for this?
I know it could be done with only two lights, but how?
It's probably easier with more...
Woah!! You got it!
Sorry would you mind telling me again, I wasn't paying attention...
Sigh... Ever since we started digging up those crystals.
I can't believe this fungi is so obtrusive. It's unwordly.
What are the MRI execs up to...
Hm... it looks like this light is going to run out of battery soon.
Oh well, I'm sure someone will fix it.
I knew I shouldn't have dropped out of school...
Yar... the treasure here be a sham...
Never shoulda trusted Catbeard, that drunkard.
boom goes here (not working)
thank you... ive been stuck there for days...
This light seems to be broken... Can you get me my cutters and wrench?
Woah, you found my wrench and wire cutters already! Let me fix this real quick...
Let there be light!
I'm gonna take a break now.
I got commissioned to fix this bridge too... must have broke in that earth quake.
Let there be light!
I'm gonna take a break now.
I got commissioned to fix this bridge too... must have broke in that earth quake.
